# transparencyMode

**Instance Property**

The mode SceneKit uses to calculate transparency for the material.

## Declaration

```swift
var transparencyMode: SCNTransparencyMode { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default transparency mode is [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNTransparencyMode/aOne]. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNTransparencyMode] for available values and their effects.

## Managing Opacity and Blending

- **transparency**: The uniform transparency of the material. Animatable.
- **SCNTransparencyMode**: The modes SceneKit uses to calculate the opacity of pixels rendered with a material, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterial/transparencyMode] property.
- **blendMode**: The mode that determines how pixel colors rendered using this material blend with other pixel colors in the rendering target.
- **SCNBlendMode**: Modes that describe how SceneKit blends source colors rendered using a material with destination colors already in a rendering target, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterial/blendMode] property.
